subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*gam||jaw; chin; molar}} (STEDT).

{{zh-ref|Bodman (1980)}} considers it to be the [[endoactive]] of {{och-l|含|to hold in the mouth}}, literally “the thing that holds something in the mouth”.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=hàn
|c=ham5
|h=pfs=ngâm/ngám
|h_note=ngâm - “chin”; ngám - “to nod”
|md=hàng
|mn=xm,zz,tp,kh,tn,tc,hc,sx,yl,km,mg:ām/qz,lk:ǎm/xm,zz:hām/qz:hǎm
|mn_note=ām/ǎm - vernacular (“neck”); hām/hǎm - literary (other senses)
|mn-t=am6/ham5
|mn-t_note=am6 - vernacular (“neck”); ham5 - literary (other senses)
|w=3hhoe
|mc=y
|oc=y
|cat=n,v,pn
}}
